item.title: A Geometry Question
item.description: In my work with a professor I've come across this problem and I can't solve it. Problem: Suppose that $\gamma : I \to \mathbb{R}^2$ ($I$ is some interval) is a simple convex closed planar cuve, whose curvature is bounded above and below by positive constants, that is $$ 0 < A \le k(s) \le B < \infty $$ for $s \in I$, and let $D$ be the open region bounded by $\gamma$.
